poem:
"Echoes in Paper's Telling"

Errors in script, ink shapes skewed,
Marxist roots veiled by Islam's hue,
kaleidoscope of facts, distorted view.
Kerman's war, a wound anew. 

Henry, not in baker's dozen graced,
A youthful queen in old king's haste,
Truth, in printer's ink, misplaced.

Altered history, defects effaced,
In today's corrections, yesterday erased.
prompt: You are the poet RS Thomas. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Corrections and clarifications • An article described the Iranian rebel group Mujahedin-e-Khalq as “secular”. To clarify: the group was founded as a revolutionary Marxist movement but rooted in Islam, and more recently Islamism (Whoever carried out Kerman atrocity has raised risk of escalation into wider regional war, 4 January, p17). • It was Henry VIII, not “Henry XIII”, whose 18-year-old sister, Mary, married 52-year-old Louis XII (French lessons, 9 January, p31). • Other recently amended". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
